text:
Hi folks. Does anybody know how to parse/convert a String to a Distribution? For example "Beta(2,5)" -> Beta{Float64}(α=2.0, β=5.0).
I am trying to store probability distributions in JSON format and read them into Julia, but am unable to successfully parse/convert.

elements.text:
Hi folks. Does anybody know how to parse/convert a String to a Distribution? For example "Beta(2,5)" -> Beta{Float64}(α=2.0, β=5.0).
I am trying to store probability distributions in JSON format and read them into Julia, but am unable to successfully parse/convert.

text: Can we cross post this publicly to <https://discourse.julialang.org|Discourse> for further visibility? React with :bridge: on the message above to approve. <https://github.com/JuliaCommunity/SlackBridge/blob/main/README.md#faq|More info here>

Success, it has been cross posted <https://discourse.julialang.org/t/56257| to Discourse>. Keep and eye out on Discourse for responses and please add an answer there once you are satisfied with the solution so others can benefit as well. Happy debugging!
Yep! Just be careful with doing that, because if you download the JSON from the internet, nothing prevents a person from putting "run(`rm -rf /`)" in the JSON file, and if you eval that...

elements.text: Yep! Just be careful with doing that, because if you download the JSON from the internet, nothing prevents a person from putting "run(`rm -rf /`)" in the JSON file, and if you eval that...

text: Thanks for the tip Jakob :slightly_smiling_face: will use it for trusted JSONs only !

elements.text: will use it for trusted JSONs only !

text: Hey <@U01Q33K9U9F>, if you were able to find an answer here on Slack, please cross post it to Discourse via the link above. Thank you!

It would probably be better to serialize it properly, to make sure it's not tampered with. Murphy's law etc.
If the file doesn't need to be human readable, you could use Serialization.serialize. Otherwise, consider storing the numbers as a vector or something else that JSON.jl can write in a parseable format.

elements.text:
